jobs_results.title: Data Analyst, Finance (SAP Lumira / BI/BWH)
jobs_results.description:
Data Analyst, Finance (SAP Lumira / BI/BWH) Jobs in Central at Epson Singapore Pte Ltd

Title: Data Analyst, Finance (SAP Lumira / BI/BWH)

Company: Epson Singapore Pte Ltd

Location: Central

Type: Full-Time

Category:

Job Summary

– Data Analyst interprets data and turns it into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions

– Data Analyst gathers information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends

– Data Analyst’s job focus on the analytical nature of the role. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, the Data Analyst will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study to the wider business/relevant colleague

– Data Analysts makes recommendations about the methods and ways in which a company obtains and analyses data to improve quality and the efficiency of data systems

Key Accountabilities

– Defining new data collection and analysis processes

– Collecting and interpreting data

– Analysing results

–... Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business

– Identifying patterns and trends in data sets

– Working alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs

Key Job Requirements

Job / Skills Competencies

– At least 4 years of hands-on operation experience as data analyst

– Experience in data models and reporting packages

– Experience in BI or BWH

– Ability to analyse large datasets

– Ability to write comprehensive reports

– Strong verbal and written communication skills

– An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving

– Attention to detail

– Pursue organizational compliance consistent with sound and high standard of conduct

– Being vocal, self-driven, motivated, able to work with minimal supervision, contribute to ideas and knowledge are highly desirable

Qualifications

– Pursuing or completed relevant professional data analytic qualification or certification

– Candidate with diploma/degree in Computer Science with accounting/business reporting knowledge will be a plus factor

jobs_results.title: Data Analytics Developer
jobs_results.description:
Company Description

Accion Labs is a global technology services firm with offering a full range of product life-cycle services in the emerging technology segment. This includes Web 2.0, Open Source, SaaS/Cloud, Mobility, IT Operations Management/ITSM, Big Data and traditional BI/DW.

Through nine global offices and a rapid-response delivery model, Accion offers a range of engagement models such as turn-key projects, extended-teams, shared-IP development, offshore-leveraged engagements and professional staffing (contract, contract-to-hire & direct perm).

Role: - Project Manager

Required

· Have managed large transformational Mainframe platform migration / re-hosting projects

· Understanding of Mainframe application related to infra needs

· Knowledge and understanding of UX / Linux

· Should have hands-on experience in projects

· Strong project management skills. PMP certification is an added advantage

· Have run a large complex project of at least 5m++

· Ability in managing and... handling 3P vendors providing application porting services and workload solutions services.

· Experience in contract administrations

· Ability in managing cross-country / regional / virtualization resources in projects

· Managing at CxO level customer

Job Description

Role: - Data Analytics Developer
Job Description:-

· 1-3 years of relevant experience in Finance domain within Banking and Financial Services

· Good Banking/Financial products knowledge preferred

· Data analysis skills with proficiency in handling large complex data

· Knowledge of PL/SQL is needed for this role

· Good knowledge in Finance/Accounting

· can work to and meet challenging deadlines

· Added advantage of knowing any analytics tools like Hadoop, Business Objects and ETL.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines

jobs_results.title: Senior / Data Analyst
jobs_results.description:
We are looking for an experienced
Senior / Data Analyst
in Singapore to make our team stronger.

Responsibilities
• Provide consultancies on data solutioning
• Be the bridge between the technical team and business units
• Team will range a diverse set of roles – Engineers, data scientists, analysts, machine learning, business, etc
• Articulate problems, solutions and functionalities to users and tech team alike
• Resolve data related issues end to end

Requirements
• Polytechnic Diploma or above in Computer Science
• 5+ years of experience in software engineering and Big Data
• Advanced knowledge at least one programming language such as Java, Python, Scala
• Familiar with SQL, Bash
• Experienced in any of big data technologies and frameworks below:
• Spark, Spark Streaming, Kafka/ Kafka Streams, Hadoop, Yarn, HDFS, Hive, Airflow, Jupyter
• Parquet, ORC, AVRO, CarbonData
• Lambda, Kappa, Data Lake
• NoSQL Data Bases
• Data platform
• Understanding of Agile and implementation of CI/CD... pipeline
• Experienced working and onboarding multiple data sources
• Able to model, ingest, process, and build required output dashboards. Machine learning angle and approach required
• Experience with integrating different data and cloud platforms
• Strong stakeholder managements

We offer
• Friendly team and enjoyable working environment
• Work-life balance and flexible schedule
• Online training library, mentoring, career development and potential partial grant of certification
• Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
• Referral bonuses
• Compensation for sick leave and paid time off
• Opportunities for self-realization

jobs_results.title: Data Analyst
jobs_results.description:
Responsibilities
• Dive into data sets affecting business requirements
• Assist in the development, testing and maintenance of data tools
• Build data pipelines to support analytics initiatives for business metrics and performance trends

Requirements
• Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
• Knowledge of AWS, Oracle SQL, Java, Python / R, SQL and Data visualization tools
• Good data analysis skills
• Strong communication skills
• Self-motivated and proactive

jobs_results.title: APAC Senior Data Analyst (Marketing Analytics)
jobs_results.description:
Job Description

Kimberly-Clark makes the essentials for a better life – with brands that matter every day, everywhere people go. Throughout our 142 years, we have challenged conventional wisdom to innovate products for the evolving needs of consumers worldwide. We’ve created new categories with top brands like Kleenex®. And we’ve redefined categories with brands like Huggies® and U by Kotex®.

While growing our $20+ billion global business, we also help build your career – through collaborative teams that push boundaries, through engaging experiences, and endless opportunities to work with some of the world’s most recognized brands. Our 42,000 employees are changing the world for the better, too, generously giving back to communities and causes around the globe. If innovative thinking and a passion to win inspire you, come Unleash Your Power at Kimberly-Clark.

Role Summary

As the APAC Senior Data Analyst (Marketing Analytics ), you will be part of the APAC Regional Digital team at... Kimberly Clark. You will work closely with the Digital & Brand teams across APAC to uncover meaningful and actionable insights to inform decision making. In this role, you will build advanced models to solve business problems and deliver data-driven recommendations to identify key marketing levers and optimize marketing spend.

Key Responsibilities

Some of your key responsibilities will include:
• Build, evaluate, publish and refresh marketing mix models (MMM) across paid, owned, earned and shared channels to analyze ROI from marketing spend, optimize spend allocation by channels and identify key sales drivers.
• Partner with cross-functional business stakeholders and agency partners to leverage the power of MMM by identifying high impact opportunities for its application and ensuring value-adoption.
• Manage data requirements for multiple projects including sourcing data across the organization, model refreshes and data integrations that support attribution models.
• Collaborate with the Digital, Brand/Marketing and technology teams to understand business and marketing objectives to develop analytics approaches
• Drive CRM analytics by working closely with CRM team (marketing & IT) to identify and analyze key trends in customer acquisition and maximize consumer engagement and retention.
• Lead initiatives to define and increase customer lifetime value within and across KC’s brands.

WHY YOU?

We seek Original Thinkers to join us. We welcome original perspectives and value different life experiences that can lead to groundbreaking innovation, creative problem solving and agile response to change. With Kimberly-Clark, you will have the freedom to express yourself, develop your capabilities and grow your career.

Key to your success in this role will be:
• Relevant Bachelors’ Degree
• Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in building regression models, customer segmentation & data-driven marketing.
• Experience in marketing mixed modelling studies
• Experience with reporting and analysis using digital marketing platforms such as Facebook Ads, Google Marketing Platform and other digital marketing platforms.
• Have a good understanding of CRM marketing (Salesforce Marketing Cloud)
• Working knowledge of business intelligence tools such as Tableau, PowerBI preferred. Experience with marketing intelligence tools like Datorama highly desirable.
• Strong statistical knowledge
• Proficient in R/Python, SQL and Google BigQuery is a big plus.
• Experience working with cross-functional and cross-geographical teams will be ideal.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex data concepts to business users.
• Self-starter and willing to take the initiative in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

jobs_results.title: Graduate Technology Associate Programme - Data & Analytics Business Analyst - CIT - Intake JUN/JUL 2021
jobs_results.description:
Crédit Agricole Corporate & Investment Bank (“CA-CIB”) Graduate Technology Associate Programme is an exciting career gateway into the financial services sector. We are seeking highly motivated graduates and aspiring tech-innovators to offer an accelerated induction experience and fast-tracked career in the banking industry.

Main Responsibilities

The Corporate IT (CIT) team is supported by its four main functions to ensure a compliant and secure delivery of its internal banking operations, data analytics reporting as well as the key delivery of innovative applications across CA-CIB’s international network.

As a Business Analyst within the CIT team, you will be put in-charge of handling IT functional activities, while ensuring process maintenance and driving the progress of key projects.

Having to work with project managers, software engineers and fellow counterparts in Crédit Agricole CIB Paris, it is vital to uphold clear and effective communication to ensure accurate delivery of... product solutions to business’ needs.

You will provide insights and recommendations based on your understanding of functional knowledge in trade finance products such as documentary credits, collections, loans and guarantees.

Scope of Work
· Analyze, assess and clarify functional specifications, from simple to complex/strategic projects.
· Write specifications and ensure validation and adherence of project's stakeholders.
· Manage the change requests during the implementation stage in coordination with sponsors, project managers and technical teams
· Follow up the implementation of the solution with software engineers and provide clarifications when necessary.
· Prepare and execute the test plan at application level. Manage the resolution of issues raised following test plan's execution.
· Manage UAT, qualify and recommend decision on user’s change requests.

Collating Business Requirements, Analysis and Testing
· Gather business requirements and clarify needs if required.
· Implement and test components from functional specifications.
· Manage user requests and participate in discussions on requirements.
· Conduct integration testing before handing over product for UAT.
· Provide functional support during UAT activities.

Projects, Maintenance and Support
· Provide functional support for applications under responsibility.
· Analyze and resolve tickets raised by end-users in production environment.
· Analyze enhancement requests as prioritized by business for live applications under responsibility and provide IT inputs.
· Produce documentation to improve support quality over time.

Functional Documentation
· Elaborate or review user's documentations (user guides, release notes etc)
· Prepare specification documentations and validate with business as per project requirements.

Co-ordination and Communication
· Co-ordinate with other business analysts, developers and end-users as needed to deliver solutions on time

jobs_results.title: Senior Manager/Manager, Data
jobs_results.description:
Develop and Implement a centralized data analytics environment
• Identify, evaluate and assess data availability and gaps in data sources to support business development requirements for a centralized data analytics environment
• Propose and architect solutions that are operationally sustainable to ensure timely updating of a centralized environment that supports analysis
• Manage the development of a centralized Data Hub
• Create and develop data models
• Prepare plans for Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) procedures
• Develop and maintain appropriate processes to ensure the centralized environment is sustainable and remains a reliable data source for analysis

Building AIC's Data Analytics Practice
• Engage stakeholders in AIC divisions to understand their business needs and recommend the use of data analytics and machine learning to achieve their business outcome
• Play a managerial role in overseeing the activities of the other executives in the data operations team to support them... in the efficient execution of their duties
• Scope out and evaluate the priority and relative value of proposed data analytics projects

Standardisation of Metadata
• Develop Metadata Governance Policies and Procedures (across the organisation)
• Work in partnership with division leads to suit Data Governance Policies to divisions processes
• Develop and maintain Metadata Catalogue and ensure clarity around source of truth
• Develop and maintain Data Dictionary to ensure clarity of definitions and data limitations
• Develop security matrix that ensures proper access defined and maintained (at data level)
• Establish make up, scope and responsibilities for an appropriate platform to address Data Governance issues
• Drive all other relevant data related efforts pertaining to the acquisition, access, distribution and policies.

Job Requirements:
• Degree in Computer Science, Data Science or Information Technology
• Minimally 8 years of experience
• Has experience in creating creating and developing data models
• Familiar with ETL tools / SQL Databases / Data Warehouse platforms
• Familiarity with handling metadata/data management and governance aspects
• Familiarity with building out taxonomies and control vocabularies
• Project Management experience OR certification (is a plus but not necessary)
• Facilitation skills to engage stakeholders would be a plus
• Experience with the healthcare sector would be a plus
• Meticulous and conscientious
• Outgoing and works well in a team
• Good listener and quick to adapt
• Business Oriented mindset

jobs_results.title: #NEXTDIGITAL2020 - Consultant / Senior Consultant, Business Intelligence (Data Visualisation)
jobs_results.description:
About NCS

NCS is a leading information and communications technology (ICT) and communications engineering services provider across the Asia-Pacific region. We are headquartered in Singapore and a wholly owned subsidiary of the Singtel Group. We have in-depth domain knowledge and unique capabilities that create business value for customers. We offer a broad range of services, including consulting, systems development and integration, business process outsourcing, infrastructure management and solutions, and technology solutions.

What is the opportunity?

NCS is looking for a data visionary to help businesses identify key performance metrics and dimensions for data analysis. You will create crystal clear, compelling visualisations of data in clients’ business intelligence or data visualisation tools – using dashboards and reports to tease out and share insights from data.

To do this, you need to have top-notch communications skills – with clients you will interact closely with, and... teams you need to collaborate with – to supply your data canvas with the information they need to convey just the right amount of information, to the right audience, and help them make better data-driven decisions.

What will you do?
• Dive into company data to identify sources and features that will drive business objectives.
• Build powerful, stand-out dashboards and automate reports for core business metrics and performance trends.
• Grasp users’ needs and challenges, and translate them into business and technology solutions
• Tap on your inner artist – use creative data visualisation techniques and tools to give users the best experience possible
• Prototype new ideas as part of a digital product team – from research to release
• Migrate and operationalise home-grown reports to enterprise grade business workflows powered by data insights - work with data engineering team throughout the data lifecycle from source to analysis to modelling.
• Work closely with project manager and technical leads to provide regular status reporting and support them to refine issues/problem statements and propose/evaluate relevant analytics solutions
• Bring your experience and ideas to effective and innovative engineering, design and strategy
• Work in interdisciplinary teams that combine technical, business and data science competencies that deliver work in waterfall or agile software development lifecycle methodologies
• The range of accountability, responsibility and autonomy will depend on your experience and seniority, including:
• Contributing to our internal networks and special interest groups
• Mentoring to upskill peers and juniors

The ideal candidate should be / possess:
• Possess good communications skills to understand our customers' core business objectives and build end-to-end data centric solutions to address them
• Good critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
• Prior experience building compelling and usable data visualizations and analytics with commercial and/or open source BI tools
• Certification or hands-on experience in leading data analytics and visualisation products such as Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, MicroStrategy, SAS Visual Analytics
• Excel in Excel!
• SQL proficiency necessary to build and maintain complex queries and data pipelines
• Undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer science or equivalent

Nice to have:
• Experience with integrating dashboards and reports into applications and web forms
• Data pipeline and/or database development experience
• Prototyping and development skills in web front-end technologies such as JavaScript frameworks (Angular, React) especially on charting libraries (Highcharts, D3, Chart.js)

If you would like to be part of the winning team that does great work, apply today!

#NCSlife

To All Agencies:

Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, by the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of Singtel Group and in the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid

jobs_results.title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist
jobs_results.description:
Product Dynamix is a strategic product management consultancy providing a holistic approach across the product management lifecycle with a focus on start-ups and growth-stage companies. We act as a catalyst to place the Product strategy mindset at the heart of the customer’s digital business. We offer in-house delivery, consultancy and training for the startup ecosystem and corporations. Our team creates digital companies, products and features to meet business ambitions.

This position is for one of our customer based in Singapore

Job Description

Defining new opportunities for product impact Influencing product and sales to solve the most impactful market problems.

Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our products.

Work as a key member of the product team to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities.

Inform, influence, support and execute our product decisions... and product launches.

Set KPIs and goals, design and evaluate experiments, monitor key product metrics, understand root causes of changes in metrics.

Exploratory analysis to discover new opportunities: understanding ecosystems, user behaviours, and long-term trends Identifying levers to help move key metrics.

Responsibilities

Product Strategy: Evaluate and define product and business KPIs and metrics along with Product Managers and Product Designers.

Data Visualization: Democratize data by building customized dashboards & reports for relevant stakeholders.

Analysis: Offer deep-dive analysis to key stakeholders across all teams and products, to determine product features and UX optimization strategies.

Respond to data and product-related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams.

Provide data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers.

Responsible for developing and executing tools to monitor and report on data quality.

Responsible for establishing appreciation and adherence to the principles of data quality management, including metadata, lineage, and business definitions. Build Machine Learning models to predict the behaviour of users

Required Qualifications

Overall, 5 years of experience with at least 1 year of experience specifically in Product Analytics, preferably in e-commerce

You've master’s degree in Business Analytics, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (Python,R & ETL frameworks)

A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics

Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics (Preferably IQ certified) or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude

Should understand Machine Learning Algorithms

Excellent attention to detail can-do attitude with a relentless focus to get things done. Data needs to be precise. Conclusions drawn from data analysis will drive critical client decisions.

Demonstrated analytical skills. Ability to work with large amounts of data: facts, figures, and number crunching. Ability to see through the data and analyze it to find conclusions.

Note : ONLY for CITIZENS and PR

jobs_results.title: Cloud Consultant, Big Data & Analytics, Looker, Google Cloud
jobs_results.description:
As a Big Data and Analytics Cloud Consultant, you will work directly with Google’s most strategic customers on critical projects to help them transform their businesses. You will provide management, consulting, and technical aptitude to customer engagements while working with customer executives and key technical leaders to deploy solutions via Google’s Cloud Platform.

You will also work closely with key Google partners currently servicing accounts to manage programs, deliver consulting services, and provide technical guidance and best practice expertise. You will also travel will be approximately 30% of the time for customer engagements.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150... countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems

options.text: AIR LIQUIDE INDUSTRIAL SERVICES PTE LTD
